TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed FormsAuthPasswordFormat extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines the encryption format for storing passwords.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To programmatically configure the type of encryption used to store passwords in a Web application, use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthenticationSection> class. This class is also used internally by <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthentication> in the processing of authentication tickets.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthPasswordFormat> enumeration. Refer to the code example in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationUserCollection> class topic to learn how to get the collection.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationCredentials#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationCredentials/CS/formsauthenticationcredentials.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationCredentials#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthenticationCredentials/VB/formsauthenticationcredentials.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthPasswordFormat Clear = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Specifies that passwords are not encrypted. This field is constant.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthPasswordFormat MD5 = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Specifies that passwords are encrypted using the MD5 hash algorithm. This field is constant.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.FormsAuthPasswordFormat SHA1 = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies that passwords are encrypted using the SHA1 hash algorithm. This field is constant.
